content.description:
One of the most alluring jughauls to a committing and somewhat blind lip encounter. Start by reaching for bottom hueco lip and campusing to the next. Loses a star for all the choss.

 Beware: Once you pull onto this thing, it WILL be difficult to reverse and step back down (you'll understand when you look at the landing). You must have good head game for this one. Also, as mentioned, it's chossy up top!
content.protection: A good spotter is more important that quantity of pads on this one
content.location: The imposing face/prow across the dropoff from Shroom

content.description:
Start with a left back step and move up and slightly across with your left to a very shallow, sharp edge. Step yoru right foot out onto a good point and rock up into an OK hueco undercling along a flared groove. Work your feet up and make a long pull to a sinker left handed sidepull pocket. Another long pull up to a pretty good edge with your right and bring your left foot up to a sloping edge near your hand level and pull over left to a good hold and an easier top out. 

  Pretty much pure power pulling, no real trickery, either you can hold the holds and pull off of them or you can't.
content.location: Around the right side of the boulder in the middle of the 45 degree over hang from a sit start at 2 small but pretty good edges.

content.description:
Sit start on obvious huecos on the far right side of the face.  Make a move left to a small incut crimp, figure out some foot trickery and move to the lip.  From here big holds lead up over the top.  Top out on the choss if desired or drop off from jugs above the lip. 

  There is an obvious extension starting around the corner on Hueco Jugs.  It doesn't make the line any harder, but does make it more fun and dangerous!
content.location: At the far right side of the Shroom boulder

content.description: juggy pumpy fun, start low on horizontal sloper jug, climb through more jugs to a powerful move to top out
content.location: through a chimney from the round room

content.description:
Two areas but you have to walk right past Shroom to get to the Camel Toe, and yes it really does have a resemblance.  

  Shroom is a single boulder with a very good harder problem, Shroom and a good easier problem V0 to the left. Several other problems exist of lesser quality. 

  Camel Toe, has the Camel Toe problem V4 or V7 with a low start and a nice overhung wall that sits above it with a handful of problems above a slab landing. 

  Seclusion is a guarantee since it is access by guided tour only.
